data.current_description:
This method opts the seller in to an eBay seller program. Refer to the Account API overview for information about available eBay seller programs.

Note: It can take up to 24-hours for eBay to process your request to opt-in to a Seller Program. Use the getOptedInPrograms call to check the status of your request after the processing period has passed.
data.summary_suggestion: Opt seller into an eBay program
data.description_suggestion: Enrolls the authenticated seller into a specified eBay seller program. Requires a Program object in the request body specifying the program to enroll in. Returns a confirmation response. Processing is asynchronous and can take up to 24 hours for eBay to complete the enrollment. Use getOptedInPrograms to verify enrollment status after the processing period. Refer to the Account API overview for available programs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about asynchronous processing and how to verify completion. Restructured to emphasize the 24-hour processing delay upfront, clarify input requirements, and provide explicit guidance on verification steps for AI agent workflow planning.

message: Operation 'getRateTables' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose and contains implementation details that distract from core functionality. Simplified to focus on what the operation does, what inputs it accepts (optional country_code), what it returns (rate tables with IDs), and key constraints (supported countries). Removed tangential information about account limits and UI navigation.

data.current_description:
This method retrieves a seller's shipping rate tables for the country specified in the country_code query parameter. If you call this method without specifying a country code, the call returns all of the seller's shipping rate tables.

The method's response includes a rateTableId for each table defined by the seller. This rateTableId value is used in add/revise item call or in create/update fulfillment business policy call to specify the shipping rate table to use for that policy's domestic or international shipping options.

This call currently supports getting rate tables related to the following marketplaces: United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, Australia, France, Italy, and Spain. Note: Rate tables created with the Trading API might not have been assigned a rateTableId at the time of their creation. This method can assign and return rateTableId values for rate tables with missing IDs if you make a request using the country_code where the seller has defined rate tables.

Sellers can define up to 40 shipping rate tables for their account, which lets them set up different rate tables for each of the marketplaces they sell into. Go to Shipping rate tables in My eBay to create and update rate tables.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the seller's shipping rate tables, optionally filtered by country code. If no country_code parameter is provided, returns all rate tables. Each returned table includes a rateTableId used to reference the table in fulfillment policies and item listings. Supports United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, Australia, France, Italy, and Spain. Note: Rate tables created via Trading API may be assigned rateTableIds by this method.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose and contains implementation details that distract from core functionality. Simplified to focus on what the operation does, what inputs it accepts (optional country_code), what it returns (rate tables with IDs), and key constraints (supported countries). Removed tangential information about account limits and UI navigation.

data.current_description:
This method creates a new return policy where the policy encapsulates seller's terms for returning items.

Each policy targets a specific marketplace, and you can create multiple policies for each marketplace. Return policies are not applicable to motor-vehicle listings.

A successful request returns the getReturnPolicy URI to the new policy in the Location response header and the ID for the new policy is returned in the response payload.

Tip: For details on creating and using the business policies supported by the Account API, see eBay business policies.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new return policy defining the seller's return terms for a specific marketplace. Accepts a ReturnPolicyRequest object specifying marketplace, return period, restocking fees, and other return conditions. Returns HTTP 201 with the new policy ID in the response body and a Location header containing the URI to retrieve the created policy. Multiple policies can be created per marketplace. Not applicable to motor vehicle listings.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity on what inputs are required (ReturnPolicyRequest structure), what the response contains, and the HTTP status code. message: Operation 'createCustomPolicy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML formatting. Improved summary to be action-oriented. Restructured description to be more concise while preserving policy type limits and clarifying the return value structure for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
This method creates a new custom policy that specifies the seller's terms for complying with local governmental regulations. Each Custom Policy targets a policyType. Multiple policies may be created as using the following custom policy types:
  • PRODUCT_COMPLIANCE: Product Compliance policies disclose product information as required for regulatory compliance.

    Note: A maximum of 60 Product Compliance policies per seller may be created.
  • TAKE_BACK: Takeback policies describe the seller's legal obligation to take back a previously purchased item when the buyer purchases a new one.

    Note: A maximum of 18 Takeback policies per seller may be created.
A successful create policy call returns an HTTP status code of 201 Created with the system-generated policy ID included in the Location response header.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new custom policy for the authenticated seller to specify terms for regulatory compliance. Supports two policy types: PRODUCT_COMPLIANCE (max 60 per seller) for disclosing product information required by regulations, and TAKE_BACK (max 18 per seller) for describing the seller's obligation to accept returns when buyers purchase replacements. Returns HTTP 201 Created with the system-generated policy ID in the Location response header and response body.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML formatting. Improved summary to be action-oriented. Restructured description to be more concise while preserving policy type limits and clarifying the return value structure for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'updateCustomPolicy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose with repetitive examples. Improved summary to be action-oriented. Restructured description to be more concise while clearly communicating the full-replacement behavior and the requirement to include all fields, plus clarifying the HTTP 204 response for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
This method updates an existing custom policy specified by the custom_policy_id path parameter. Since this method overwrites the policy's name, label, and description fields, always include the complete and current text of all three policy fields in the request payload, even if they are not being updated.

For example, the value for the label field is to be updated, but the name and description values will remain unchanged. The existing name and description values, as they are defined in the current policy, must also be passed in.

A successful policy update call returns an HTTP status code of 204 No Content.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing custom policy specified by the custom_policy_id path parameter. This operation performs a full replacement of the policy's name, label, and description fields - all three fields must be included in the request payload even if only some are being modified. Returns HTTP 204 No Content on successful update. Partial updates are not supported; provide complete current values for all fields.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with repetitive examples. Improved summary to be action-oriented. Restructured description to be more concise while clearly communicating the full-replacement behavior and the requirement to include all fields, plus clarifying the HTTP 204 response for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'createFulfillmentPolicy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description contains helpful information but is verbose with HTML formatting and external links. Improved summary to be action-oriented. data.current_description:
This method creates a new fulfillment policy for an eBay marketplace where the policy encapsulates seller's terms for fulfilling item purchases. Fulfillment policies include the shipment options that the seller offers to buyers.

A successful request returns the getFulfillmentPolicy URI to the new policy in the Location response header and the ID for the new policy is returned in the response payload.

Tip: For details on creating and using the business policies supported by the Account API, see eBay business policies.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fulfillment policy for an eBay marketplace that defines the seller's terms for fulfilling item purchases, including shipment options offered to buyers. Returns HTTP 201 Created with the new policy ID in the response body and a getFulfillmentPolicy URI in the Location response header. The policy can then be associated with listings to define shipping options and fulfillment terms.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description contains helpful information but is verbose with HTML formatting and external links. Improved summary to be action-oriented. Restructured description to be more concise while preserving key information about policy purpose, return values, and usage context for AI agents.

message: Operation 'getSalesTax' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML markup and important notes that should be distilled. Simplified to focus on core functionality while preserving critical constraints about marketplace availability and US territory restrictions.

data.current_description:
This call retrieves the current sales-tax table entry for a specific tax jurisdiction. Specify the jurisdiction to retrieve using the countryCode and jurisdictionId path parameters. All four response fields will be returned if a sales-tax entry exists for the tax jurisdiction. Otherwise, the response will be returned as empty.

Note: Sales-tax tables are only available for the US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces.

Important! In the US, eBay now calculates, collects, and remits sales tax to the proper taxing authorities in all 50 states and Washington, DC. Sellers can no longer specify sales-tax rates for these jurisdictions using a tax table.

However, sellers may continue to use a sales-tax table to set rates for the following US territories:

  • American Samoa (AS)
  • Guam (GU)
  • Northern Mariana Islands (MP)
  • Palau (PW)
  • US Virgin Islands (VI)
For additional information, refer to Taxes and import charges.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve sales tax rate for jurisdiction
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the sales tax table entry for a specific tax jurisdiction identified by country code and jurisdiction ID. Returns the tax rate and shipping/handling tax indicator if an entry exists for the jurisdiction, or an empty response if no entry is configured. Available only for US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces. Note: US sellers cannot set rates for the 50 states and DC; rates are only configurable for US territories (AS, GU, MP, PW, VI).
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML markup and important notes that should be distilled. Simplified to focus on core functionality while preserving critical constraints about marketplace availability and US territory restrictions.

message: Operation 'createOrReplaceSalesTax' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML markup. Clarified that this is a create-or-update operation (idempotent PUT), specified request body requirements, and distilled marketplace and territory restrictions for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
This method creates or updates a sales-tax table entry for a jurisdiction. Specify the tax table entry you want to configure using the two path parameters: countryCode and jurisdictionId.

A tax table entry for a jurisdiction is comprised of two fields: one for the jurisdiction's sales-tax rate and another that's a boolean value indicating whether or not shipping and handling are taxed in the jurisdiction.

You can set up sales-tax tables for countries that support different tax jurisdictions.

Note: Sales-tax tables are only available for the US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces.
Retrieve valid jurisdiction IDs using getSalesTaxJurisdictions in the Metadata API.

For details about using this call, refer to Establishing sales-tax tables.

Important! In the US, eBay now calculates, collects, and remits sales tax to the proper taxing authorities in all 50 states and Washington, DC. Sellers can no longer specify sales-tax rates for these jurisdictions using a tax table.

However, sellers may continue to use a sales-tax table to set rates for the following US territories:

  • American Samoa (AS)
  • Guam (GU)
  • Northern Mariana Islands (MP)
  • Palau (PW)
  • US Virgin Islands (VI)
For additional information, refer to Taxes and import charges.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update sales tax table entry
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new or updates an existing sales tax table entry for a specific jurisdiction. Requires country code and jurisdiction ID path parameters, and a request body containing the tax rate and a boolean flag indicating whether shipping and handling are taxed. Returns the created or updated sales tax entry. Available only for US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces. Note: US sellers cannot set rates for the 50 states and DC; rates are only configurable for US territories (AS, GU, MP, PW, VI). Use getSalesTaxJurisdictions in the Metadata API to retrieve valid jurisdiction IDs.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML markup. Clarified that this is a create-or-update operation (idempotent PUT), specified request body requirements, and distilled marketplace and territory restrictions for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Use this call to retrieve all sales tax table entries that the seller has defined for a specific country. All four response fields will be returned for each tax jurisdiction that matches the search criteria. If no sales tax rates are defined for the specified, a 204 No Content status code is returned with no response payload.

Note: Sales-tax tables are only available for the US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces.

Important! In the US, eBay now calculates, collects, and remits sales tax to the proper taxing authorities in all 50 states and Washington, DC. Sellers can no longer specify sales-tax rates for these jurisdictions using a tax table.

However, sellers may continue to use a sales-tax table to set rates for the following US territories:

  • American Samoa (AS)
  • Guam (GU)
  • Northern Mariana Islands (MP)
  • Palau (PW)
  • US Virgin Islands (VI)
For additional information, refer to Taxes and import charges.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all sales tax entries by country
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all sales tax table entries configured by the seller for a specific country. Returns an array of tax entries, each containing the jurisdiction ID, tax rate, and shipping/handling tax indicator. Returns a 204 No Content status with no payload if no tax entries are defined for the country. Available only for US (EBAY_US) and Canada (EBAY_CA) marketplaces. Note: US sellers cannot set rates for the 50 states and DC; rates are only configurable for US territories (AS, GU, MP, PW, VI).
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with HTML markup and contains a typo ('specified' incomplete). Clarified that this returns an array of entries with specific field details and emphasized the 204 No Content response condition for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Note: This method was originally created to see which onboarding requirements were still pending for sellers being onboarded for eBay managed payments, but now that all seller accounts are onboarded globally, this method should now just return an empty payload with a 204 No Content HTTP status code.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves Know Your Customer (KYC) onboarding requirements for the seller account. This method is deprecated and now returns a 204 No Content status with an empty payload for all seller accounts, as all sellers have been globally onboarded for eBay managed payments. Historically, this method was used to identify pending onboarding requirements during the managed payments transition.
